200.description: List of buckets associated with this authenticated account.

get.summary: Returns list of shared environments for a specified bucket.

200.description: List of shared environments belonging to this bucket.

201.description: Details of the new test environment.

put.summary: Update the details of a shared environment.

parameters.name: environmentId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for a test environment

201.description: Details of the modified test environment.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of error messages in a bucket

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maxiumum number of messages to return. Default 50, max 1000.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Only return messages after the given Unix timestamp

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Only return messages before the given Unix timestamp

200.description: List of error messages in a bucket

get.summary: Retrieve a list of messages in a bucket

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maxiumum number of messages to return. Default 50, max 1000.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Only return messages after the given Unix timestamp

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Only return messages before the given Unix timestamp

200.description: List of messages in a bucket

The response includes a list of result objects for the message(s) submitted. It will always return an array, even if only one message was created. The order of the result objects corresponds to the order of messages submitted.

code.description: A numeric error code for the specific problem we encountered with this message. (error status only)

message.description: A description of the problem we encountered with this message. (error status only)

more_info.description: A link to more help about the warning. (error status only)

error.description: An object representing errors for this item. Only present if status is error, otherwise this will be null.

status.description: One of the following: success, error, or warning.

unique_identifier.description: If the message had a unique_identifier, it will be returned in this field, to help match the responses to the messages that were submitted.

code.description: A numeric error code for the specific problem we encountered with this message. (warning status only)

message.description: A description of the problem we encountered with this message. (warning status only)

more_info.description: A link to more help about the warning. (warning status only)

warning.description: An object representing warnings (non-fatal warnings) for this item. Only present if status is warning, otherwise this will be null.

get.summary: Retrieve the details for a single message.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for this message

200.description: List of messages in a bucket
List of tests for this bucket
List of tests for this bucket

get.summary: Retrieve the details of a given test by ID.

200.description: Returns an object with the details of the given test.

put.summary: Modify a test's name, description, default environment and its steps. To modify other individual properties of a test, make requests to the steps, environments, and schedules subresources of the test.

201.description: Returns 201 and the updated test's JSON description if the test is successfully updated.

delete.summary: Delete a test, including all steps, schedules, test-specific environments and results.

get.summary: Return details of the test's environments (only those that belong to the specified test)

200.description: List of environments belonging to this test.

201.description: Details of the new test environment.

put.summary: Update the details of a test environment.

parameters.name: environmentId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for a test environment

201.description: Details of the modified test environment.

get.summary: Return details of the test metrics for the specified timeframe.

200.description: List of average response times and additional performance metrics belonging to this test.

get.summary: List test steps for a test.

200.description: List of test steps for a test

201.description: Details of the new test step.

400.description: Must send valid JSON object to create a new test step

put.summary: Update the details of a single test step.

parameters.name: stepId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for a test step

200.description: List of test steps for a test

400.description: Unable to update template '{stepId}' for test '{testId}'

delete.summary: Delete a step from a test.

parameters.name: stepId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for a test step

get.description: List currently connected agents associated with a given team.

200.description: List of the teamâ€™s currently connected agents.

get.description: Returns a list of integrations configured for the team.

200.description: List of integrations associated with the team.

get.description: List people and integrations associated with a given team.

200.description: List of people associated with the team.

email.description: The email address for this account. Only present if authorized with the account:email scope.

id.description: The unique identifier for this account.

name.description: The name of the person for this account.

agent_id.description: The unique identifier for this agent.

name.description: The name of the agent set in the configuration file or with the command line flag.

auth_token.description: Bucket auth token if set, otherwise this value is null.

default.description: True if this bucket is the 'default' for a team. Default buckets cannot be deleted.

key.description: The unique identifier used to address a bucket.

name.description: The name of this bucket as displayed in your dashboard.

verify_ssl.description: True if this bucket is configured to verify ssl for requests made to it.

id.description: The unique identifier for this environment.

integrations.description: The list of integrations for this environment.

regions.description: An array of the region codes that this environment is using.

script_library.description: The list of ids for scripts, part of the script libraries, being used for this environment.

stop_on_failure.description: Stop executing the test after the first failed step.

test_id.description: The unique identifier for this test.

verify_ssl.description: Validate all SSL certificates on any HTTPS connections.

status.description: Success or failure status of call.

changes_from_last_period.description: The changes in average response time compared to the last period.

environment_uuid.description: The environment_uuid that filters this request.

region.description: The region that filters this request.

response_times.description: The list of response times based on the timeframe of the request.

avg_response_time_ms.description: The average response time in miliseconds for all the requests for this test in this time interval.

success_ratio.description: 1 if there's a successful request in this time interval, or 0 if there isn't.

timestamp.description: The timestamp in Unix format for the specified timeframe.

this_time_period.description: The average response time for different percentiles for the request in the requested timeframe.

timeframe.description: The timeframe that filters this request.

team_id.description: Unique identifier for the team to create this bucket for.

body.description:
HTTP request body (most commonly used for POST and PUT requests). If the
request body contains binary data that cannot be included directly in the 
JSON, encode the content with Base64 and include the body_encoding attribute accordingly.

body_encoding.description:
If the request body was encoded with Base64, this field should be present and set to 
"base64". If not specified, defaults to "plaintext"

form.description:
JSON object of set of form fields included in a POST request. 
Values can either be represented as a string or as an array of strings.

headers.description: JSON object of header keys and values -- with values as a string or an array of strings.

method.description: HTTP method name (GET, POST, PUT, HEAD, OPTIONS, PATCH, DELETE, etc.)

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp indicating when the request was made.

url.description: Full URL of the request, including URL querystring parameters.

body.description:
HTTP response body. If the response body contains binary data that cannot be
included directly in the JSON, you should encode the content with Base64.

body_encoding.description:
If the request body was encoded with Base64, this field should be present and set to 
"base64". If not specified, defaults to "plaintext"

headers.description: JSON object of header keys and values -- with values as a string or an array of strings.

reason.description:
Textual description of HTTP status code. This will be set automatically if not 
provided in the API call. For example, if the status code is 404, this will be 
set to "Not Found" unless you explicitly specify a different reason.

response_time.description: Length of time it took to receive the response, in seconds.

status.description: HTTP status code returned in the response.

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp indicating when the request was made.

id.description: The unique identifier for this team.

created_at.description: The date the test was created in seconds (Unix time stamp format).

step_type.description: Type of test step -- request, pause, condition, ghost-inspector, or subtest.

assertions.description: A list of assertions to apply to the HTTP response from this request.

auth.description: An authentication object with either basic, oauth1, or client_certificate credentials for authenticating this request.

before_scripts.description: A list of pre-request scripts to run before this request.

body.description: A string to use as the body of the request.

form.description: An object with keys as form post parameter names matched to their values. Values can either be a single string or an array of strings.

headers.description: An object with keys as header names matched to their values. Values can either be a single string or an array of strings.

method.description: The HTTP method for this request step. E.g. GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.

note.description: A description or note for this request step.

scripts.description: A list of post-response scripts to run after this request.

url.description: The URL to make a request to for this step. This may contain both query string parameters and variables.

variables.description: A list of variables to extract out of the HTTP response from this request.

environmentId.name: environmentId
environmentId.description: Unique identifier for a test environment

stepId.name: stepId
stepId.description: Unique identifier for a test step
